snippet: Roy Hildebrant, 48, a crucial supporter of the Crown Heights Farmers Market, died on Aug. 11, and the market’s future without him remains in doubt.
abstract: Future of the farmers market in Crown Heights, Brooklyn is unclear after the death of farmer Roy Hildebrant, who supplied much of the market's produce; many of New York City's poorer neighborhoods rely on the crucial support of farmers like Hildebrant, who took the time to understand local palates and bring fresh and welcome foods to diverse communities.
lead_paragraph: Roy Hildebrant, 48, a crucial supporter of the Crown Heights Farmers Market, died on Aug. 11, and the market’s future without him remains in doubt.

headline.seo: Struggling Crown Heights, Brooklyn, Farmers’ Market Loses Farmer
headline.main: Struggling Brooklyn Market Loses a Farmer
headline.print_headline: Struggling Brooklyn Market Loses a Farmer
